questions.promptMd: Which process change MOST reduces halo and recency effects in option selection?

answers.contentMd: Score options against agreed criteria individually before group discussion
Debate options openly, then pick the loudest consensus
Choose based on latest data point only
Let the highest‑ranked person decide without scoring

questions.promptMd: True or False: A pre‑mortem (imagining failure) can surface risks that standard planning overlooks.

answers.feedbackMd: Correct. Pre‑mortems elicit hidden failure modes.
Pre‑mortems are a proven debiasing tool.

questions.promptMd: Which precommitment is MOST effective to prevent scope creep during review?

answers.contentMd: Agree on evaluation criteria and "out of scope" items before seeing proposals
Let criteria emerge organically in debate
Use last year’s criteria regardless of change

questions.promptMd: True or False: External review from a neutral party primarily adds delay without quality benefits.

answers.feedbackMd: Neutral reviews can reveal blind spots and improve rigor.
Correct. Use judiciously to raise decision quality.
